snippet: Umpire Don Denkinger’s missed call in the 1985 World Series helped the Kansas City Royals to the title, but human error remains a big part of baseball.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column considers the debate over the use of instant replay in Major League Baseball, noting the infamous blown call in the 1985 World Series.
lead_paragraph: Umpire Don Denkinger’s missed call in the 1985 World Series helped the Kansas City Royals to the title, but human error remains a big part of baseball.

headline.seo: Missed Umpiring Call in 1985 World Series Still Resonates
headline.main: With Replay Being Debated, Missed Call in ’85 Resonates
headline.print_headline: With Replay Being Debated, Missed Call in ’85 Resonates
